title: US DOGE Service Agreement with Department of Labor Reveals $1.3 Million Fee
summary: A leaked service agreement between the Department of Labor and the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) shows a $1.3 million fee for DOGE's work, contradicting Elon Musk's previous claims that DOGE would cost taxpayers nothing. The agreement covers four DOGE affiliates over an 18-month period, with an implied annual salary of approximately $217,000 per staff member.
description: A leaked service agreement reveals the Department of Labor's financial commitment to DOGE, highlighting potential discrepancies between Musk's public statements and actual government expenditures. The 18-month contract backdated to the Trump administration's start suggests strategic positioning of DOGE within federal agencies.
